description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.4 (approved plans) pursuant to planning permission reference  171005VAR (Allowed Appeal: APP/A5270/W/17/3182079) dated 18/01/2018 for' Removal of Condition Number 9 (No more than 106 dwellings within Phase 1 shall be occupied until Castle House is fully demolished and the site cleared in preparation for the construction of the Phase 2 part of the development) -  pursuant to planning permission ref. P/2015/4089 dated 20/02/2017'
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before 20th February 2020.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Submission of reserved matters application(s) for Phase 2 of development hereby permitted shall be made before 19 February 2020. Commencement of Development of the Part approved shall begin within two years from the date of the approval of the reserved matters for that Part.  Commencement of Development in relation to the remainder of the development must begin within two years from the date of the last reserved matters approval for the entire site.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | No Part of the development as hereby permitted shall commence until the reserved matters, as listed below, for that Part have been approved by the London Borough of Ealing as the local planning authority:
o appearance
o landscaping

The relevant Part of the development shall in all respects be carried out in accordance with the approved reserved matters for that Part, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the London Borough of Ealing as the local planning authority.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans (00)_001 P01; (00)_002 P01; (20)_001 P01; (20)_010 P01; (20)_150 P01; (20)_510 P01; (20)_551 P01; (20)_553 P01; (20)_556 P01; (20)_558 P01 and (20)_700 P01 all as prepared by CJCT. Design and Access Statement dated July 2015 as prepared by CJCT Design Codes & Parameter Plans dated October 2015 as prepared by CJCT. Planning Statement dated August 2015 as prepared by WYG; Air Quality Assessment dated July 2015 UK11-21599 as prepared by Ramboll Environ; Phase I Environmental Assessment dated October 2014, UK14-20789 as prepared by Environ; Daylight & Sunlight Report dated July 2015 as prepared by GL Hearn; Bat Building Survey and Extended Phase I Habitat Survey report dated March 2015 as prepared by Corylus Ecology; Energy Assessment dated July 2015, UK11-21599 as prepared by Ramboll Environ; Flood Risk Assessment dated July 2015, UK11-21599 as prepared by Ramboll Environ; Landscape Design and Access Report, 3005-RT04A as prepared by MACFARLANE & Associates; Noise and Vibration Impact Assessment, R5714-1 Rev 1 dated June 2015 as prepared by 24 Acoustics Ltd; Consultation Statement dated July 2015 as prepared by GL Hearn; Sustainability Statement, UK11-21599 dated July 2015 as prepared by Ramboll Environ; Townscape & Visual Appraisal Issue 2, Job Number AP03996 dated August 2015 as prepared by WYG Group; Transport Assessment Ref 30689/D1b dated July 2015 as prepared by TPP; Tree Survey Report Ref 2811_RP_001A dated August 2013 as prepared by LLoyd Bore Ltd; Agents letters Ref AP03996 dated 23 October 2015 to GLA and LB Ealing as prepared by WYG; Covering email dated 8 October 2019 as prepared by Jonathan Rowlatt, Director, Union 4 Planning; documents titled 'Rome House, Ealing W5 Phase One, Design and Access Statement' dated September 2019; 'Rome House, Ealing Phase 1 Block A, B, C Section 73 Comparison Document' and 'Rome House, Ealing Phase One - Drawing Schedule' all as prepared by KDS Associates Limited; drawing numbers 3666_PL_03_101; 3666_PL_03_103; 3666_PL_03_105; 3666_PL_03_107; 3666_PL_03_109; 3666_PL_03_111; 3666_PL_05_101; 3666_PL_05_103; 3666_PL_05_105; 3666_PL_05_107; 3666_PL_21_221; 3666_PL_21_222; 3666_PL_21_223; 3666_PL_21_224; 3666_PL_21_225; 3666_PL_04_101; 3666_PL_04_103;

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of all external materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of works on site.  The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved materials and be retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 1.1(h) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy Development Plan Document, 2012; policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document, 2013. | Prior to the commencement of any development, details of a site demolition and construction method statement/management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The method statement/management plan shall include the following:
a) The number of on-site construction workers and details of the transport options and parking facilities for them;
b) Anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site;
c) Delivery times and booking system (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods);
d) Site access for construction traffic and contractor staff parking and associated signage and required works to facilitate this;
e) Consolidate or re-timed trips;
f) Dust suppression measures for the standards set out in the 'Best Practice Guidance: The control of dust and emissions from construction and demolition';
g) Wheel washing provisions;
h) Site security;
i) Secure off-street loading and drop-off facilities;
j) Vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear;
k) Details as to the locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices;
l) Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents;
m) Using TfL's Freight Operator Recognition Scheme or similar;
n) The submission of evidence of the condition of the highway prior to construction and a commitment to make good any damages caused during construction;
o) Details of parking restrictions which may need to be implemented during construction work.
Such details shall be implemented and phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.

Reason: To protect the amenity of local residents, to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy DPD (2012); policies 6.3, 6.14, & 7.13 - 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.

| The details of hard and soft landscaping including the tree protection and tree planting proposals as submitted to and approved by the local planning authority shall be laid out and planted prior to the occupation of the development.  Any trees or plants which within 5 years of panting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size and species and in the same positions within the next planting season.  The landscaping shall thereafter be maintained permanently.

Reason:  To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2016. | An Urban Design Settlement shall accompany each reserved matters application that shall be submitted for approval in writing by the local planning authority. The statement shall demonstrate how the design of that part broadly complies with the relevant principles set out in the outline approved Design and Access Statement and design code.

Reason: To ensure high design standards and materials are used in the interests of the visual amenities of the locality. In accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016; policies 1.1(h) and 1.1(k) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy DPD 2012; and policies 7.4 and 7B of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD 2013. | The single energy centre shall be designed to facilitate future connection to Ealing District Heating Network as shown in amended plan SK-001 Rev A contained within "151023 Full Response to GLA and LBE" letters. The right to connect shall be subject to the following conditions being satisfied:

i) The proposed tariff structures must protect the interests of the developer and occupiers, in that total costs for delivery of the service shall be no more than would have been the case if the on-site CHP had been provided. Tariffs include unit consumption charges, standing charges, management fees and plant replacement funds;
ii) Connection charges to the network are reasonable and economically viable; and
iii) A service level agreement can be entered into to protect the interests of the developer and occupiers by way of a guarantee of system availability.

The right to connect shall also be subject to any regulatory changes governing the communal supply of energy.  In the event that the network is available to the development prior to completion of construction, and the developer connects to the network, the developer will be released from obligations to install stand-alone heating or cooling plant.  In the event that the network is not available to the development prior to completion of construction, the developer will remain obliged to connect to the network at any economically viable opportunity, but it is recognised that this opportunity may not arise until the end of the economic life of the stand-alone heating or cooling plant.

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016; policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy DPD 2012; and policies 5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, 2013. | Prior to the final completion of all dwellings in Phase 1, the approved dwellings shall incorporate measures to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 36.59% (equal to at least 71.44 tonnes CO2 per annum) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Energy Statement (15 July 2015) and additional information and amendments received on 23 October 2015, all prepared by Ramboll Environ:
a) Energy saving measures to achieve at least 2.14% (equal to 4.18 tonnes CO2 per annum) in regulated carbon dioxide emissions savings over the compliant BR Part L 2013 baseline;

b) Combined heat and power of 35kWe/62KWth capacity located in the single energy centre in Block B of Phase 1 to achieve a reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of 25.86% (equal to 45.25 tonnes CO2 per annum) beyond the Be Lean case will be achieved;

c) Incorporation of solar PV technology with a total capacity of 49.74kWp/c.334m2 to achieve at least a percentage of 11.28% (equal to 22.02 tonnes C02 per annum) in carbon dioxide emissions savings over the Be Lean case.

Within three months of the first occupation of the new dwellings, the Energy Performance Certificates, Accompany Advisory Reports and modelling output reports from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted to the local planning authority for written approval.

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016; policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy DPD 2012l; policies 5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, 2013 and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | Notwithstanding the approved Energy Assessment prepared by Ramboll Environ (31/07/2015) and additional clarifying information contained within '151023 Full Responses to GLA & LBE' letters, prior to commencement of Phase 1 of the development, dynamic thermal modelling should be submitted to the local planning authority for written approval demonstrating that the development performs against its overheating criteria or even exceeds the overheating CISBE TM49 guidance standards.

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to reduce the risk of overheating in line with policy 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 DPD, 2012 and Development Management DPD, 2013.

| The scheme of photovoltaic panels, which shall provide for no less than 49.74kWp, equal to 22.02 tonnes CO2 savings per annum (beyond Be Clean stage), shall be eligible under relevant standards of the Microgeneration Certification Scheme and installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the development to which the photovoltaic panels serve.

Reason: In the interest of sustainable development and combating climate change in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 and 5.7 of the London Plan 2016; policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012; and policy 5.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD, 2013.

| The energy centre, as shown in amended plan SK-001 Rev A contained within "151023 Full Responses to GLA and LBE" letters, hereby approved shall be installed and operational prior to first occupation of Phase 1 of the development and shall thereafter serve all dwellings within the development including Phase 2 blocks of flats and houses.

Reason: In the interest of securing the centralised energy centre for the site and its sustainable connection to the development in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 DPD, 2012 and Ealing's Development Management DPD, 2013.

| Within six months of the commencement of the superstructure works on the approved development, details of the installation of the Ultra-Low NOx gas boilers and CHP engine that are compliant with the NOx (g/m2) benchmarks set out within the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG, April 2014 shall be submitted to the local planning authority for written approval.  The approved boilers/engines shall be installed prior to first occupation of the development.

Reason: To minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016; the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG; policies 1.1(e) and (j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012, and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, 2013.

| Upon final completion of the development and prior to occupation, suitable devices for monitoring the renewable/low carbon energy equipment shall be installed.  The monitored data shall be submitted to the local planning authority at daily intervals for a period of three years from final completion.  The installation of the monitoring devices should be in a compatible format and the submission of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in Automated Energy (& CO2) Monitoring Platform document.

Reason: To monitor the effectiveness of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an evidence base on the performance of such equipment in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 5.7 of the London Plan 2016, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012 and Development Management DPD, 2013.

| Details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to occupation for the installation in each apartment of an Ultra Low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of under 0.40 g/kWh.  The works as approved shall be completed prior to occupation of the dwellings and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: To minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016; the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG; policies 1.1(e) and (j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012, and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, 2013. | Prior to first occupation of Phase 1, the approved dwellings shall incorporate sustainability measures as detailed in the approved Sustainability Statement prepared by Ramboll Environ (31 July 2015) and any clarifications contained within "151023 Full Responses to GLA & LBE letters".

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, policies 5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012.
| The development shall be designed to achieve a water use target for the residential development of no more than 105 litres per person per day.
Reason: To ensure the sustainable use of water, in accordance with policy 5.15 of the London Plan 2016.

| Notwithstanding the approved Energy Assessment prepared by Ramboll Environ (31/07/2015) and additional clarifying information contained within "151023 Full Responses to GLA & LBE" letters, a revised Energy Statement shall be submitted to the local planning authority for written approved prior to the commencement of development on Phase 2.  The Energy Statement shall outline the measures to be incorporated into the development to comply with the relevant Building Regulations and London Plan climate change policies at the time of the submission of the relevant reserved matters application.  Compliance with the emissions saving target may be shown based on the calculation of carbon savings at the time that the phase is connected to the proposed district heating network.  The Energy Strategy should be based on connection of Phase 2 to the site wide district heating network served by the single energy centre located in Block B in Phase 1.

A dynamic thermal modelling analysis evidencing how the development performs against its overheating criteria or even exceed the overheating standards as described in CISBE guidance TM49 should also be submitted to the local planning authority for approval.  The relevant phase of development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016; policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD 2012, policies 5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, 2013 and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | Notwithstanding the Sustainability Statement prepared by Ramboll Environ (31/07/2015), prior to the commencement of Phase 2 of the development a sustainability statement, which includes full details of the sustainability measures that are to be incorporated into the development to achieve the requirements of the local and regional planning policies shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  In demonstrating compliance, reference to the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG, their criteria, or other appropriate assessment methodology may be appropriate.

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.6 and 5.7, 5.9, 5.10, 5.11, 5.12, 5.13, 5.14, 5.15, 5.17, 5.18, 5.20, 5.21, 5.22 of the London Plan 2016, Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 DPD, 2012 and Ealing's Development Management DPD, 2013.

| Upon final completion of the development and prior to occupation, suitable devices for monitoring the renewable/low carbon energy equipment shall be installed.  The monitored data shall be submitted to the local planning authority at daily intervals for a period of three years from final completion.  The installation of the monitoring devices should be in a compatible format and the submission of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specification as indicated in Automated Energy (& CO2) Monitoring Platform document.

Reason: To monitor the effectiveness of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an evidence base on the performance of such equipment in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 5.7 of the London Plan 2016, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 DPD, 2012 and Development Management DPD, 2013.

| Within six months of the commencement of the superstructure works on the approved development, details of the installation of the Ultra Low NOx gas boilers and CHP engine that are compliant with the NOx (g/m2) benchmarks set out within the Mayors Sustainable Design and Construction SPG valid at the time of the submission of the relevant reserved matters application shall be submitted to the local planning authority for written approval.  The approved boilers/engines shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the development.

Reason: To minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016; the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG; policies 1.1(e) and (j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012, and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, 2013.

| Details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to occupation for the installation in each dwelling of an Ultra Low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of under 0.30g/kWh.  The works as approved shall be completed prior to occupation of the dwellings and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: To minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016; the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG; policies 1.1(e) and (j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012, and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, 2013.

| The 246 No. on site cycle parking facilities shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and shall be completed and made available prior to the first occupation of the development the thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for cycle parking within the site in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 2.1 of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012; policy 6.13 of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document, 2013; policies 6.9 & 6.13 of The London Plan, 2016 and The National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| All of the car parking and the associated access and manoeuvring areas shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and these shall not thereafter be obstructed or used for any other purpose.

Reason: To provide adequate facilities for disabled drivers, in accordance with policies 6.13 and 7.2 of the London Plan 2016 and policy 1.1(h) of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012.
| The refuse and recycling storage enclosures hereby approved shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to first occupation of the development and retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012; policies 3.5, 7A, & 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD, 2013; policies 5.16, 6.3 & 7.15 of the London Plan, 2016 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Before development commences, a scheme for providing fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms facing the railway, the supply to be provided from the rear of the building at high level, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The approved mitigation scheme shall be implemented in its entirety before any of the units are occupied and shall thereafter be retained.

Reason: To ensure that the development accords with policy 7.14 of the London Plan 2016; policy 1.1 of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012; policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD, 2013 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Notwithstanding the content of the Noise & Vibration Impact Assessment dated 19 June 2015, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, including, as appropriate, the noise exposure category and BS4142 rating prior to installation. The details shall also include the noise mitigation measures with windows closed and other means of ventilation.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012; policies 7A & 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD, 2013; policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2016); Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Prior to the occupation of the dwellings within Phase 1 hereby approved, details of an acoustic barrier to protect noise sensitive residential amenity areas from railway traffic noise shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Barriers shall be manufactured and constructed to the local planning authority's specifications as specified at SPG10.  The approved scheme shall be fully completed before occupation of the dwellings and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012; policies 7A & 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD, 2013; policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Insulation of the floor/ceiling between the ground floor plant rooms, car park and the dwelling above shall be installed to meet an acoustic standard not exceeding NR25 Leq 5mins (octaves) or NR20 Leq 5mins (one third octaves) inside a bedroom and NR30 Leq 5mins (octaves), or NR25 Leq 5mins (one third octaves) inside a living room when noise is generated from the ground floor plant rooms and car park.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012: policies 7A & 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD, 2013; policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Notwithstanding the content of the Phase 1 Environmental Assessment; Ref: UK14-20789 dated 31/10/14 an intrusive contaminated land investigation and risk assessment of the site shall be carried out in accordance with BS1075:2011 + A1:2013 and CR11 guidance to assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site.  This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person and shall assess any contamination of the site, whether or not it originates on the site.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area and the future residents of the site in accordance with policy 1.1 of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012; policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management DPD, 2013; policy 5.13 of The London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), DEFRA and the Environment Agency's 'Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11', and the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.

| The approved remediation scheme as set out in document reference 068347.100_CUR_00_XX_RP_GE_001 Revision 01 dated 1 October 2019 as prepared by Curtins Consulting Limited shall be carried out in accordance with its terms prior to the commencement of development other than that required to carry out remediation (including ground works, site clearance and demolition), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.
The local planning authority must be given four weeks written notification of commencement of the remediation works.  The scheme shall thereafter be retained as such.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area and the future residents of the site in accordance with Policy 1.1 of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 DPD, 2012; Policy 5.21 of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD, 2013; Policy 5.13 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), DEFRA and the Environment Agency's 'Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11', and the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.) | Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out shall be produced and submitted to and subject to the approval in writing of the local planning authority.  The verification report submitted shall be in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area and the future residents of the site in accordance with policy 1.1 of the adopted Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy 2026, DPD, 2012; policy 5.21 of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD, 2013; policy 5.13 of The London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), DEFRA and the Environment Agency's 'Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11', and the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'.
| The proposed external lighting scheme shall be designed to reduce light pollution to nearby residents and road users and where applicable the recommendations of the following guidance shall be met:
- ILP Guidance Notes for the reduction of Obtrusive Lighting 2011.
- Institution of Lighting Professionals Technical Report No 5, Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements.
- CIE Technical Report - Guide on the limitation of effects of obtrusive light from outdoor lighting insulations - CIE 150: 2003.
- Statutory Nuisance from Insects and Artificial Light by Department of Environment Food. Guidance on sections 101, 102 and 103 of the Clean Neighbourhoods and Environment Act 2005, Defra.
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory form of development and to protect the amenities of neighbouring residential occupiers.
| Four parking spaces sh
